subject: Management
title: The Feedback Sandwich Myth
description: A fast breakdown of The Feedback Sandwich Myth for builders.

hook.text: A manager said: great work, but your report was wrong, but your attitude is wonderful. The employee heard nothing.

buildup.text: The feedback sandwich: positive, negative, positive. It's the most taught and least effective method.

discovery.text: People learn to ignore the bread and brace for the filling. The pattern becomes transparent.

twist.text: Worse: it trains people to distrust your compliments. Every nice thing becomes a setup.

climax.text: Give positive and constructive feedback separately. Each deserves its own moment and full attention.

punchline.text: Ditch the sandwich. Serve each dish on its own plate.

quiz.question: Why is the feedback sandwich ineffective?
options: People learn to distrust compliments and ignore the positive framing
Sandwiching makes negative feedback feel too harsh
The method is too difficult for most managers to execute
